workflow.name: AI job relevancy scorer: Search LinkedIn Jobs with GPT-4o-mini & Google Sheets
workflow.description:
## üß† Workflow Overview ‚Äî AI-Powered Jobs Scraper & Relevancy Evaluator

This workflow automates the process of finding **highly relevant job listings** based on a user‚Äôs **resume**, **career preferences**, and **custom filters**. It scrapes fresh job data, evaluates relevance using **OpenAI GPT models**, and automatically appends the results to your **Google Sheet tracker** ‚Äî while **skipping any jobs already in your sheet**, so you don‚Äôt have to worry about duplicates.

Perfect for recruiters, job seekers, or virtual assistants who want to automate job research and filtering.

---

## ‚öôÔ∏è What the Workflow Does

1. **Takes user input through a form** ‚Äî including resume, preferences, target score, and Google Sheet link.
2. **Fetches job listings** via an **Apify LinkedIn Jobs API actor**.
3. **Filters and deduplicates results** (removes duplicates and blacklisted companies).
4. **Evaluates job relevancy** using **GPT-4o-mini**, scoring each job (0‚Äì100) against the user‚Äôs resume & preferences.
5. **Applies a relevancy threshold** to keep only top-matching jobs.
6. **Checks your Google Sheet for existing jobs** and prevents duplicates.
7. **Appends new, relevant jobs** directly into your provided **Google Sheet**.

---

## üìã What You‚Äôll Get

* A personal **Job Scraper Form** (public URL you can share or embed).
* Automatic **job collection & filtering** based on your inputs.
* **Relevance scoring** (0‚Äì100) for each job using your resume and preferences.
* Real-time **job tracking Google Sheet** that includes:

  * Job Title
  * Company Name & Profile
  * Job URLs
  * Location, Salary, HR Contact (if available)
  * Relevancy Score

---

## ü™Ñ Setup Instructions

### **1. Required Accounts**

You‚Äôll need:

* ‚úÖ **n8n account** (self-hosted or Cloud)
* ‚úÖ **Google account** (for Sheets integration)
* ‚úÖ **OpenAI account** (for GPT API access)
* ‚úÖ **Apify account** (to fetch job data)

---

### **2. Connect Credentials**

In your n8n instance:

1. Go to **Credentials** ‚Üí **Add New**:

   * **Google Sheets OAuth2 API**

     * Connect your Google account.
   * **OpenAI API**

     * Add your OpenAI API key.
   * **Apify API**

     * Replace `<your_apify_api>` with your apify api key.

2. **Set Up Apify API**
 
    **Get your Apify API key**

   * Visit: https://console.apify.com/settings/integrations

   * Copy your API key.


   **Rent the required Apify actor before running this workflow**

     * Go to: https://console.apify.com/actors/BHzefUZlZRKWxkTck/input

      * Click ‚ÄúRent Actor‚Äù.

Once rented, it can be used by your Apify account to fetch job listings.

---

### **3. Set Up Your Google Sheet**

1. **Make a copy** of this template:
   [üìÑ Google Sheet Template](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Pabh4GDMc0CBK5S6gn8FxpRgLbyXZVN656JNkBH6f7Y)
2. **Enable Edit Access** for anyone with the link.
3. Copy your sheet‚Äôs URL ‚Äî you‚Äôll provide this when submitting the workflow form.

---

### **4. Deploy & Run**

1. Import this workflow (`jobs_scraper.json`) into your n8n workspace.

2. Activate the workflow.

3. Visit your form trigger endpoint (e.g. `https://your-n8n-domain/webhook/jobs-scraper`).

4. Fill out the form with:

   * Job title(s)
   * Location
   * Contract type, Experience level, Working mode, Date posted
   * Target relevancy score
   * Google Sheet link
   * Resume text
   * Job preferences or ranking criteria

5. Submit ‚Äî within minutes, new **high-relevance job listings** will appear in your Google Sheet automatically.

---

## üß© Example Use Cases

* Automate **daily job scraping** for clients or yourself.
* Filter jobs by **AI-based relevance** instead of keywords.
* Build a **smart job board or job alert system**.
* Support a **career agency** offering done-for-you job search services.

---

## üí° Tips

* Adjust the ‚ÄúTarget Relevancy Score‚Äù (e.g., 70‚Äì85) to control how strict the filtering is.
* You can add your own **blacklisted companies** in the `Filter & Dedup Jobs` node.

parameters.formDescription: Provide your preferences to extract the relevant jobs. The Google Sheet should follow this template: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1oOigTwntedPCYiXwW-98oHDj4slYepsFFV-LLP-77uc/edit?gid=0#gid=0

parameters.content:
* Collects user input such as resume, preferences, and Google Sheet link via a public form.

* The form automatically triggers the workflow when submitted.
Converts the form selections (contract type, experience, etc.) into API-ready parameters for Apify‚Äôs LinkedIn Jobs Scraper.

* Calls the Apify API to fetch job listings based on your parameters.

* Requires your Apify API key and the LinkedIn Jobs actor rented from Apify.
Removes duplicates, filters out blacklisted companies, and excludes listings without a valid company profile.

## Score and Filter Jobs by Relevance
* Sends each job listing, along with your resume and preferences, to the GPT-4o-mini model.
* The model returns a relevance score (0‚Äì100) for each job.
* Keeps only the jobs that meet or exceed your target relevancy score (defined in the form).

## Add New jobs to the Google Sheet
* Fetches all job IDs already present in your Google Sheet to prevent duplicates.
* Compares new jobs with existing ones in your Google Sheet.
* Only keeps jobs that are not yet in your sheet.

values.content:
=You are an expert recruiter and job relevance evaluator. Please find a relevancy score for a given job against the Candidate Resume and Preferences. 

Candidate Resume:
{{ $('On form submission').first().json['Your Resume'] }}

Candidate Preferences:
{{ $('On form submission').first().json["Your Job Instructions/Preferences"] }}

Important Notes:
- If salary is not given under job details, check it in the job_description or job_position.
- When giving the relevancy score, be strict and give a good score(>80) to only those jobs that are highly relevant for the candidate.

‚ö†Ô∏è Output format requirement:
Always return only a JSON array with exactly one object, in this structure:
[
  {
    "id": "...",
    "relevancy_score": <integer 0-100>
  }
]
No other text, comments, or formatting.

parameters.content:
## üß† AI-Powered Job Scraper & Relevance Evaluator

This workflow automates the process of finding and ranking the most relevant job opportunities based on your resume, career preferences, and custom filters.

It uses Apify‚Äôs LinkedIn Jobs API to fetch fresh job listings, then applies OpenAI GPT models to assign a relevance score (0‚Äì100) for each job.
Only jobs that meet or exceed your target score are appended to your Google Sheet, while duplicates are automatically skipped.

### ‚öôÔ∏è How to Set Up

1. **Connect Accounts**
   * Add credentials for:
     * Google Sheets (OAuth2)
     * OpenAI API
     * Apify API (replace <your_apify_api> with your key)

2. **Prepare Your Google Sheet**
   * Copy the template: üìÑ [Google Sheet Template](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Pabh4GDMc0CBK5S6gn8FxpRgLbyXZVN656JNkBH6f7Y/edit?gid=0#gid=0)
   * Enable Edit Access for anyone with the link.

3. **Run the Workflow**
   * Open your public form (auto-generated webhook link).
   * Fill in your resume, preferences, and target relevancy score.
   * Submit ‚Äî within minutes, new, high-relevance jobs will appear in your Google Sheet.

user.name: Yasir
user.bio: I‚Äôm an AI automation expert specializing in building smart, no-code and low-code workflows in n8n. I help businesses automate repetitive tasks, integrate complex systems, and scale their operations with custom end-to-end automation solutions. My focus is on combining AI tools with workflow automation to save time, improve efficiency, and drive smarter business decisions.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
